ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: improving Portuguese fluency primarily through engagement with different forms of Brazilian art. We also practiced the subjunctive at the very end of the course
I continued to develop my Portuguese oral and writing skills, as I have for the past 3 semesters. I was also able to develop some creativity through some of the projects we had to do.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength of this course is the diversity of different types of media relating to Brazilian culture that we engaged with, as well as Laura's desire to help us improve our linguistic and cultural competency. I do wish we spent some more time on grammar and set vocabulary lists to make sure our skills kept developing/the final project tested our technological skills without much aid. 

The asynchronous class days did take significantly longer to complete than the synchronous days.

i think it would be beneficial for the asynchronous day to be held on either thursday or friday. I really enjoyed the variety of cultural content in the course, but I would have liked slightly more grammar help.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone who has taken lower level Portuguese classes at Yale or who are looking to go into L5 in the future. The way the course is taught is great because it allows for a lot group work and classroom discussion which is critical when learning a language. Also, we get to learn about very interesting concepts about Brazilian culture and go further into a specific topic in an L5 class.
